text: <!channel>: leftover snacks/food from the design retreat in the kitchen. Potato chips / dried mangoes in the cabinet. Lots of baby carrots and hummus in the fridge. And a bunch of eggs for anyone that wants to take them home.

sorry to be continually vocal on airplay stuff in the office. We’re in an ADI meeting right now where their team is sharing to the projector. It keeps dropping and/or freezing. Not sure what we can or should do to fix in future, but it’s jarring for the flow of these meetings.
is that the one in glass?
well we can run a cat5e cord from the old printer cabinet to glass
not sure what else to do. or if it's worth doing at this point
whatever we can do is helpful. I don’t know the last meeting i’ve had where we can just use airplay without caveats of any sort.
Can we run hdmi drops in the interim
it would hard/impossible to do that cleanly in glass
glass is also the special case since all the other apple tvs are hardwired. so if people are having problems elsewhere with wireless, they can hardwire ethernet
do you want an HDMI cord <@U0265G76F>?
not at this moment no thanks. Just making note for future
FWIW, I had that problem, but fixed it by changing my energy saving settings yesterday. May have just been a coincidence though.
we’ve had three different people get kicked off while presenting so i’m not sure it’s about the individual computers :confused:
